Looking to create a new app and I wanted to experiment with Flutter. My two concerns of themeing and charts were alieviated by two blog posts, but letâ€™s try itÂ out!

Installing Flutter

The dreaded step is always installing an SDK just for experimentingâ€¦ but here we go.

Installation Link: https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

I needed to fix some installation issues which Flutter helped me out with. For a front-end developer, this was really helpful.

Unfortunately it also took forever, thanks to XCode.

After forever, weâ€™re now ready to go! (Iâ€™m choosing to work in VS Code)

Andriod Emulator and iOS Simulator

Before I could get to coding I had to set up the Android and iOS devices on my machine. Fortunately I had ones set up for previous projects, I just needed to launch them like so:

$ flutter emulators
$ flutter emulators --launch Pixel_2_XL_API_28
$ flutter emulators --launch iOS Simulator
$ flutter run -d all

This runs the starter app on both!

Starter App

Now to start messing around! Iâ€™m using this tutorial provided from the Flutter team as a start.

With the tutorial, I created a list (useful) and started learning about Flutterâ€™s state (not really though).

I continued on to part 2, which had me add interactive icons to list items to save them, navigate to a page to view saved list items, and begin theming the app.

Theming

Theming is one of the big reasons I wanted to try Flutter and itâ€™s got a theming framework I wanted to try.

Times andÂ Blue

First try at theming was promising, even just with changing the font and the primary colour. I feel like itâ€™s generally stuck to the typical Material Design layout with the AppBar shadow and the darker background colour. Fortunately, I was quickly able to fix those, but Iâ€™m not certain I can make Flutter bend to all my UI wishes, would need more exploration.

Graphs

Equally important as theming is the ability to have good graphs. For this Iâ€™m looking at charts_flutter recommended by the quick tutorial blog post here.

The tutorial is to get a bar chart up but I need a line chart with specific properties, which proved to be much more difficult thanks to some of the code from the bar chart tutorial messing me up. I had to redo the bar chart demo a couple of times and add in this Line Chart demo carefully.

I donâ€™t care for my chart being interactive, so I dropped that extra fluff from the tutorial. What I need is to make the graph moveable and zoomable along the yaxis, which I donâ€™t think flutter_charts will be able to do.

But I tried anyway, starting with a bunch of different tutorials from here. I actually ran into a lot of errors while trying to set all these up and while some of them were clearly due to my unfamiliarity with Flutter, some of them were very: ðŸ¤¨. Thatâ€™s a drawback.

I ended up finding the Numeric Initial Viewport Axes Example which did the scrolling y-axis for me and just needed to combine it with the Selection Callback Interactions Example (which features a TimeSeriesChart, which I need). This actually proved to be quite difficult.

In the end I wasnâ€™t able to get it to work seemingly due to a bug that hasnâ€™t been fixed. This is how it wouldâ€™ve worked though, by setting up a viewport and allowing PanAndZoomBehavior.:

new charts.TimeSeriesChart(
widget.seriesList,
animate: widget.animate,
domainAxis: new charts.DateTimeAxisSpec(
viewport: new charts.DateTimeExtents(
start: new DateTime(2017, 10, 3),
end: new DateTime(2017, 10, 10))),
behaviors: [new charts.PanAndZoomBehavior()],
selectionModels: [new charts.SelectionModelConfig(
type: charts.SelectionModelType.info,
changedListener: _onSelectionChanged,
)],
)

Turns out Flutter isnâ€™t capable of the graphing I needÂ :(

Conclusion

In conclusion, Flutter seems like a pretty cool way to make apps but unfortunately itâ€™s chart library isnâ€™t functional and customizable enough.

Looks like Iâ€™m sticking to Ionic Angular with plot.lyÂ :)

Follow me

For more of my coding, designing, and problem solving journey, follow me on Twitter and Medium. I like to post about new things Iâ€™m doing and am interested in.Â :)
